verses.kjv: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
verses.ct: From the elder, to my dear friend Gaius, whom I genuinely love.

verses.kjv: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
verses.ct: Dear friend, my greatest hope is that you are doing well in every way and that your health is as strong as your soul is.

verses.kjv: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
verses.ct: It brought me tremendous joy when some brothers arrived and shared how you are living according to the truth — that you continue to walk in the truth.

verses.kjv: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.
verses.ct: Nothing makes me happier than hearing that my children are living in the truth.

verses.kjv: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;
verses.ct: Dear friend, you are showing real faithfulness in everything you do for the brothers, especially for those you don't even know.

verses.kjv: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:
verses.ct: They have spoken about your love in front of the church. You will do a good thing if you help them continue on their journey in a way that honors God.

verses.kjv: Because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
verses.ct: They set out for the sake of his name, and they accepted no support from non-believers.

verses.kjv: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.
verses.ct: So we should welcome people like them, so that we become partners in spreading the truth.

verses.kjv: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
verses.ct: I wrote a letter to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves being in charge, refuses to acknowledge us.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.
verses.ct: So if I come, I will call attention to what he has been doing — spreading malicious nonsense about us. And that's not all: he also refuses to welcome the brothers himself, stops those who want to, and throws them out of the church.

verses.kjv: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
verses.ct: Dear friend, don't imitate what is evil — imitate what is good. Whoever does good belongs to God, but whoever does evil has never truly known God.

verses.kjv: Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.
verses.ct: Everyone speaks well of Demetrius, and the truth itself confirms it. We also vouch for him, and you know that our testimony is reliable.

verses.kjv: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:
verses.ct: I have a lot more to say to you, but I'd rather not put it all down with ink and pen.

verses.kjv: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Greet the friends by name.
verses.ct: Instead, I hope to see you very soon, and we'll talk in person. Peace to you. Our friends here send their greetings. Please greet each of our friends there by name.
